title.native: 阿波連さんははかれない season2

description:
The second season of Aharen-san wa Hakarenai.

The quiet, awkward Aharen-san and her schoolmate Raidou went from unlikely friends to nearly inseparable. As another semester begins, new opportunities, challenges, and relationships present themselves as Aharen-san and Raidou navigate their school days. Now, Aharen-san struggles to know how vulnerable she can get with a new transfer student.

(Source: Crunchyroll, edited)

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

node.description:
__Doujin Circle:__ Milmake Orange (ミルメークオレンジ)
__Loves:__ Sushi and Uniforms

[Website](http://mizuasato.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mizuasato) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/13134)

Currently freelance he resides in Tokyo. Yoshioka is a member of the Writers' Guild of Japan and the Television and Radio Writers' Association of Japan.

[Website](http://www.takawo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takawoy) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/takawoyy)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Yasukiti01)

__Hometown:__ Anjo, Aichi Prefecture, Japan

Yasutaka Yamamoto debuted as a storyboard maker and a producer with episode 34 of Idaten Jump (2005) after working as an assistant producer for My Melody (2005) He then worked as an assistant director for The Orphans of Simitra (2008), and debuted as a director with Valkyria Chronicles the following year. Since then, he has worked on many productions as a director, storyboard maker, and producer. Some of these titles include: Actually, I Am… (2015), Hinomaru Sumo (2018), and Nekopara (2020).

_Source: Crunchyroll Expo 2020_

Currently freelance he resides in Tokyo. Yoshioka is a member of the Writers' Guild of Japan and the Television and Radio Writers' Association of Japan.

[Website](http://www.takawo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takawoy) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/takawoyy)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/1247856912399339520) | [Website](https://kotsu2.site)

A story "creation lab" ran by novelist Tetsuya Sano.

**Members:**
- [Tetsuya Sano](https://anilist.co/staff/126059/) (佐野徹夜)
- [Shouichi Taguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/112059/) (田口囁一)
- [Ai Iwasawa](https://anilist.co/staff/123792/) (岩沢藍)
- Shion Yuuki (結城紫雄)

[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/kosaki) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_kosaki)

A Japanese composer and arranger. He joined NAMCO as a soundtrack composer in 1999, and then he joined MONACA Inc. as a music designer in 2004.

Soundtracks he has worked on credited as MONACA: 
- Star Driver: Kagayaki no Takuto (with Keigo Hoashi and Ryuichi Takada) 
- Hourou Musuko (with Keigo Hoashi and Keiichi Okabe) 
- A-Channel (with Kakeru Ishihama, Ryuichi Takada, Keigo Hoashi)

[Website](https://monaca.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_jp)

__MONACA__ is a Japanese music production studio, which was established by the composer Keiichi Okabe in October 2004.

__Members__:
• [Keiichi Okabe](https://anilist.co/staff/121585/Keiichi-Okabe) (CEO)
• [Satoru Kousaki](https://anilist.co/staff/101555/Satoru-Kousaki)
• [Ryuuichi Takada](https://anilist.co/staff/109459/Ryuuichi-Takada)
• [Kakeru Ishihama](https://anilist.co/staff/150946/Kakeru-Ishihama)
• [Hidekazu Tanaka](https://anilist.co/staff/141852/Hidekazu-Tanaka)
• [Keiichi Hirokawa](https://anilist.co/staff/156490/Keiichi-Hirokawa)
• [Kuniyuki Takahashi](https://anilist.co/staff/154774/Kuniyuki-Takahashi)
• [Shuotarou Seo](https://anilist.co/staff/317330/Shoutarou-Seo)
• [Oliver Good](https://anilist.co/staff/317296)
• [Keita Inoue](https://anilist.co/staff/229376/Keita-Inoue)

__Past Members__:
• [Yuri Mitsumi](https://anilist.co/staff/201236/Yuri-Misumi)
• [Keigo Hoashi](https://anilist.co/staff/111233/Keigo-Hoashi)
Kouichirou Natsume is representative director & president of Aniplex company.

__[Website](https://zutomayo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/zutomayo_staff) | [Instagram (run by ACA-NE)](https://www.instagram.com/zutomayo/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCv6P5nsS9rP4tDtFlqLU_QQ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/38WbKH6oKAZskBhqDFA8Uj?si=5bjHWeOJTmKT7BgIOkRdJA)__

__Introduction:__
Zutto Mayonaka de Iinoni, better known by their international name Zutomayo (stylized as ZUTOMAYO), is a Japanese rock band under record label EMI Records Japan, affiliated with Watanabe Entertainment. 

The group is quite secretive by nature, seeing as they have never released a full member list, with each work crediting different people for their music production, lyrics, composition and arrangement. The only reoccurring member is the vocalist, who is only known as an unindentified woman going by the stage name "ACA-NE" (pronounced Akane). It can additionally be noted that their secrecy is a contributing factor to their popularity.

__Biography:__
Zutomayo debuted by releasing their first song "Byoushin wo Kamu" on YouTube on June 4, 2018. The song became an immediate hit on release, garnering 200,000 views within its first week on the platform. Additionally, after releasing the single through streaming platforms on August 30, the song became the most streamed song that week. Following their song's release, Zutomayo held their first concert at the Daikanyama Loop in Tokyo. Attendees were handed opaque glasses and reported that the entire venue was dark for the duration of the concert. The group would continue to conceal their identities in future concerts as well.

Zutomayo released two more singles digitally before releasing their first EP, Tadashii Itsuwari Kara no Kishou, on November 14 in the same year, through record label EMI Records Japan. The EP peaked 8th on the Oricon Albums Chart and was nominated in the 19th CD Shop Awards. On June 5, 2019, a second EP was released titled Imawa Imade Chikaiwa Emide, which peaked at the number one spot on the Oricon chart. Later in that same year on October 30, they would release their first full-length album titled Hisohiso Banashi.

__Members:__
- [ACA-NE](https://anilist.co/staff/170316/ACANE) (ACAね, Akane) – vocalist, in-charge of lyrics and composition

(Source: [Wikipedia (JP)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%9A%E3%81%A3%E3%81%A8%E7%9C%9F%E5%A4%9C%E4%B8%AD%E3%81%A7%E3%81%84%E3%81%84%E3%81%AE%E3%81%AB%E3%80%82), edited)
